document.id: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R23-005
document.heading: PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO COUNCIL RESOLUTION NO. SI-R23-005
Act Amending Pueblo de San Ildefonso Big Game Hunting Act to Authorize Feral Cattle Hunts
document.preamble: At a duly called meeting of the Council of San Ildefonso Pueblo on the 24th day of March, 2023, the following law was adopted:

recital.text: the Council recognizes the importance of managing wildlife and natural resources on Pueblo lands; and,

the Council enacted the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Big Game Hunting Act in 2012 to regulate wildlife harvesting to ensure that hunting is conducted in a way that is safe for hunters and protects wildlife resources; and,

feral cattle numbers on the Pueblo's lands are increasing and are detrimentally impacting the cultural and natural resources of the Pueblo, including negatively impacting the natural wildlife and their habitat on Pueblo lands; and,
the Council has determined it to be in the best interest of the Pueblo to amend the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Big Game Hunting Act ("Act") to allow for the hunting of feral cattle on Pueblo lands.
that the Council hereby enacts the attached law entitled, "ACT AMENDING PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO BIG GAME ACT TO AUTHORIZE FERAL CATTLE HUNTS."

procedural-data.text: The foregoing resolution was duly voted upon by the Council on March 24, 2023, at a meeting with a vote of 9 in favor, 0 opposed, 1 abstaining and 0 absent (Governor presiding and not voting) pursuant to the authority vested in the Council by the Agreement of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.
DELIVERY OF THE RESOLUTION TO THE GOVERNOR:

Resolution No. SI-R23-005 was presented to the Governor of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso on the 24th day of March , 2023, pursuant to the Governing document of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso ("Agreement"), GOVERNOR, Sec. 4 (c), and will become effective after signature by the Governor or veto override by the Council.
{ } VETO - RETURNED TO COUNCIL WITH EXPLANATION:
Presented by the Governor to the Council on the ____ day of ____________, 2023.

The foregoing resolution was duly voted upon by the Council on _________________, 2023, at a meeting with a vote of ______ in favor, _____ opposed, _____ abstaining and _____ absent (Governor presiding and not voting) pursuant to the authority vested in the Council by the Agreement of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.

attachment.heading: ACT AMENDING PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO BIG GAME ACT TO AUTHORIZE FERAL CATTLE HUNTS

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the "ACT AMENDING PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO BIG GAME HUNTING ACT TO AUTHORIZE FERAL CATTLE HUNTS." ("the Act").

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of this Act is to amend the Pueblo's Big Game Hunting Act to authorize and regulate the harvesting of feral cattle on Pueblo lands to reduce feral cattle numbers and protect the Pueblo's natural wildlife and habitat.

section.heading: Findings
section.text: The Council hereby finds and declares that:

para.text: The Council recognizes the importance of managing wildlife and natural resources on Pueblo lands.

The Council enacted the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Big Game Hunting Act in 2012 to regulate wildlife harvesting to ensure that hunting is conducted in a way that is safe for hunters and protects wildlife resources.

Feral cattle numbers on the Pueblo's lands are increasing and are detrimentally impacting the cultural and natural resources of the Pueblo, including negatively impacting the natural wildlife and their habitat on Pueblo lands.
It is in the best interest of the Pueblo to amend the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Big Game Hunting Act to allow for the hunting of feral cattle on Pueblo lands.
The Council authorizes the amendment of the Pueblo's Big Game Hunting Act, as shown in the attached document, to allow for the hunting of feral cattle on Pueblo lands.
Amendment of the Big Game Hunting Act shall become effective immediately upon final signature of this Act.

The Governor or his designee is authorized to take such actions to implement the intent of this Act, including the authority to make such non-substantive edits to the Big Game Hunting Act as may be needed.
"Bag limit" means the maximum number of a particular game species which may be taken by anyone in one day by a license holder.
"Big game animals" means all deer and elk species, and may include feral cattle.
"Bow" means bow and arrows, and includes compound, recurve, and longbow. Arrows must have broadheads. No drugs may be used on arrows.
"Carcass" means the dead body of any animal or any identifiable part of it.
"Closed Season" means the time during which a category or species of animal may not be hunted or taken.
"Department" means the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Natural Resources Department.
"Director" means the Director of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Natural Resources Department.
"Feral cattle" means cattle without brands, ear tags or other signs of ownership.
"Firearm" means pistols, revolvers, rifles, shotguns and any device that is capable of being used as a weapon because it expels a projectile by some means of force.
"Governor" means the Governor of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso or his or her designee.
"Member" means a person enrolled in the Pueblo de San Ildefonso pursuant to the Governing Agreement and laws of the tribe governing enrollment.
"Open season" means the time during which a designated category of animals may be hunted or taken pursuant to provisions of this Act.
"Tribal Ranger" means a ranger in the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Parks and Wildlife Department.
"Possession" means on the hunter's person or in his/her immediate control.
"Pueblo" means the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.

"Pueblo lands" means all lands and interests in land within the exterior boundaries of the Pueblo and any additional lands acquired by the Pueblo. Also includes land assignments, community property areas, and public rights-of-way.

"Sell" means to offer or possess for sale, barter, exchange or trade, or the act of selling, bartering, exchanging or trading. Sharing of game meat with other members of the Pueblo to avoid spoilage is permitted.
Feral Cow: A feral cow of either sex and any age.

Interference with Tribal Ranger: Any person who disobeys or disregards a direct order of, or interferes with a Tribal Ranger or other tribal official while performing his or her duties under this Act shall have violated this Act and upon conviction, shall be assessed a fine of $300.

section.heading: Forfeitures of Sporting Arms
section.text: Sporting Arms may be seized by the Pueblo and forfeited if they are used to take or attempt to take game in violation of this Act. Sporting Arms may be confiscated at the scene. Upon confiscation, Sporting Arms shall be transported to the Department of Natural Resources for receipt and retention pursuant to a procedure to be prescribed by the Director. A receipt shall be issued to the violator with a description of the Sporting Arm and date. Any Sporting Arms confiscated are subject to forfeiture upon conviction.

section.heading: Subject Matter Jurisdiction Conferred to Tribal Court
section.text: The Pueblo de San Ildefonso Tribal Court shall have subject matter jurisdiction to adjudicate all issues of law and fact, and to enter decrees appropriate to such jurisdiction, pertaining to civil proceedings on complaints filed by the Department of Natural Resources pursuant to this Act.
